The probability of any 2 people not havi: The probability of any 2 people not having the same birthday is 364 ∕ 365: Given the birthday of the first person, there are 364 possible different days for the second person. The probability of 3 people not having the same birthday is 364×363 / 365² because the third person can't share a birthday with either of the first two, so there are only 363 days to choose from. Therefore the probability of 23 people not having the same birthday would be 364×363×362×...×343 / 365²² = 0.4927. Hence, the probability of 2 or more people sharing the same birthday must be 1−0.4927 = 0.5073, or 50.73%. (The fun fact is still true even if we consider leap years in our computation).
